DataElement.preferredDefinition: The dosage form in which the ECTRT is physically presented.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exposure as Collected Domain Exposure as Collected Dose Form
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected._The form in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) of the collected exposure are physically presented.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Concepts.definition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Property.preferredDefinition: The form in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) of the collected exposure are physically presented.

Concepts.definition: The form in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) of the collected exposure are physically presented.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/8/19 tmt released. 8-21-18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Pharmaceutical Dosage Form Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Pharmaceutical Dosage Form within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A discoid-shaped solid containing the medicinal agent in a suitably flavored base; troches are placed in the mouth where they slowly dissolve, liberating the active ingredients.

Concepts.definition: A solid discoid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a suitably flavored base, that dissolves when sucked in the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alcoholic or hydroalcoholic solution prepared from vegetable materials or from chemical substances.

Concepts.definition: A solution composed of an alcoholic extract or solution of nonvolatile active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A narrow woven fabric, or a narrow extruded synthetic (such as plastic), usually with an adhesive on one or both sides.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of narrow woven fabric or a narrow extruded synthetic material, usually with an adhesive on one or both sides.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A plug made of cotton, sponge, or oakum variously used in surgery to plug the nose, vagina, etc., for the control of hemorrhage or the absorption of secretions.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a plug made from absorbent material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a colored or an uncolored water-soluble sugar.

Concepts.definition: A tablet covered with sugar.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and possesses the ability to dissolve in fluids.

Concepts.definition: A tablet that will dissolve in a liquid solvent to form a solution.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tablet Orally Disintegrating Delayed Release Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tablet Orally Disintegrating Delayed Release Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances which disintegrates rapidly, usually within a matter of seconds, when placed upon the tongue, but which releases a drug (or drugs) at a time other than promptly after administration.

Concepts.longName: Orally Disintegrating Delayed Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A tablet that disintegrates rapidly, usually within a matter of seconds, when placed upon the tongue but is also designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances which disintegrates rapidly, usually within a matter of seconds, when placed upon the tongue.

Concepts.definition: A tablet which disintegrates and dissolves quickly (usually within a matter of seconds) in the mouth. Additional water to complete dissolution is not necessary.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Multilayered Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Multilayered Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances that have been compressed to form a multiple-layered tablet or a tablet-within-a-tablet, the inner tablet being the core and the outer portion being the shell, which, additionally, is covered in a designated coating; the tablet is formulated in such manner as to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.longName: Multilayered Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A tablet composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that have been compressed into multiple layers and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances that have been compressed to form a multiple-layered tablet or a tablet-within-a-tablet, the inner tablet being the core and the outer portion being the shell.

Concepts.definition: A tablet composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that have been compressed to form a tablet that contains multiple layers.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tablet dosage form that is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon administration with no enhanced, delayed or extended release effect.

Concepts.definition: A tablet dosage form that is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon administration with no enhanced, delayed or extended release effect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tablet that forms a suspension when placed in a liquid (formerly referred to as a Dispersible Tablet).

Concepts.definition: A tablet that changes into a suspension when added to a liquid solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tablet that forms a solution when placed in a liquid.

Concepts.definition: A tablet that changes into a solution when added to a liquid solvent.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Film Coated Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Film Coated Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a thin layer of a water-insoluble or water-soluble polymer; the tablet is formulated in such manner as to make the contained medicament available over an extended period of time following ingestion.

Concepts.longName: Film Coated Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A tablet covered with a thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a thin layer of a water-insoluble or water-soluble polymer.

Concepts.definition: A tablet covered with a thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing a drug which allows at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented in conventional dosage form.

Concepts.definition: A tablet designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing, in addition to active ingredients, mixtures of acids (citric acid, tartaric acid) and sodium bicarbonate, which release carbon dioxide when dissolved in water; it is intended to be dissolved or dispersed in water before administration.

Concepts.definition: A tablet composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), and a mixture of acids and sodium bicarbonate, which release carbon dioxide when dissolved in water.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Delayed Release Particles Tablet Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Delayed Release Particles Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing a conglomerate of medicinal particles that have been covered with a coating which releases a drug (or drugs) at a time other than promptly after administration. Enteric-coated articles are delayed release dosage forms.

Concepts.longName: Delayed Release Particle Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A tablet composed of individual fragments have been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form which releases a drug (or drugs) at a time other than promptly after administration. Enteric-coated articles are delayed release dosage forms.

Concepts.definition: A tablet that has been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing a conglomerate of medicinal particles that have each been covered with a coating.

Concepts.definition: A tablet composed of a conglomerate of particles that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s) that have been individually covered with a coating.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is covered with a designated coating.

Concepts.definition: A tablet whose outer shell is covered with a substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents that is intended to be chewed, producing a pleasant tasting residue in the oral cavity that is easily swallowed and does not leave a bitter or unpleasant after-taste.

Concepts.definition: A tablet that must be chewed to release the active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An oral solution containing high concentrations of sucrose or other sugars; the term has also been used to include any other liquid dosage form prepared in a sweet and viscid vehicle, including oral suspensions.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension composed of a viscid vehicle that contains a high concentration of sucrose or other sugars and active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small piece of relatively flat absorbent material that contains a drug. A swab may also be attached to one end of a small stick. A swab is typically used for applying medication or for cleansing.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a small piece of absorbent material attached to one end of a small stick.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A strand or fiber used to hold wound edges in apposition during healing.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of fibrous strands of material that are used to bind wound edges together.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A suspension which is usually administered in a dropwise fashion.

Concepts.definition: A suspension intended for administration in a drop-wise fashion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation consisting of solid particles dispersed throughout a liquid phase in which the particles are not soluble; the suspension has been formulated in a manner to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form (e.g., as a solution or a prompt drug-releasing, conventional solid dosage form).

Concepts.definition: A suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug delivery system in the form of a suppository that allows at least a reduction in dosing frequency.

Concepts.definition: A suppository that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A long narrow piece of material.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a long narrow piece of material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosage form prepared in a relatively long and slender often cylindrical form.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a long, slender cylindrical shape.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation containing solid particles dispersed in a liquid vehicle and in the form of coarse droplets or as finely divided solids to be applied locally, most usually to the nasal-pharyngeal tract, or topically to the skin.

Concepts.definition: A spray composed of a suspension that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-pressurized dosage form consisting of valves which allow the dispensing of a specified quantity of spray upon each activation.

Concepts.definition: A spray contained in a device with valves that permits the dispensing of a specified quantity of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An absorbent pad of folded gauze or cotton.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a porous, interlacing, absorbent, usually shape retaining material, such as cellulose wood fibers or plastic polymer form.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution which is usually administered in a drop-wise fashion.

Concepts.definition: A solution intended for administration in a drop-wise fashion.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Gel Forming Solution Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Gel Forming Solution Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution that forms a gel when it comes in contact with ocular fluid, and which allows at least a reduction in dosing frequency

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Gel Forming Solution Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A solution that becomes gelatinous upon administration and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gel Forming Drops Solution Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gel Forming Drops Solution Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution, which after usually being administered in a drop-wise fashion, forms a gel.

Concepts.longName: Gel Forming Drop Solution Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A solution intended for administration in a drop-wise fashion; it becomes gelatinous upon administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile solution intended to bathe or flush open wounds or body cavities; they're used topically, never parenterally.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension used to bathe or flush open wounds or body cavities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A device inserted and left in the uterus to prevent effective conception.

Concepts.definition: A solid intended for placement within the uterine cavity where active and/or inert ingredient(s) are released from an apparatus at a controlled rate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specially formulated and shaped solid preparation (e.g., ring, tablet, or stick) intended to be placed in the vagina by special inserters, where the medication is released, generally for localized effects; the extended release preparation is designed to allow a reduction in dosing frequency.

Concepts.definition: An insert designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specially formulated and shaped solid preparation (e.g. ring, tablet, or stick) intended to be placed in the body, where drug is released, generally for localized effects.

Concepts.definition: A solid or semi-solid intended for administration within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation, suitable for injection, which consists of solid particles dispersed throughout a liquid phase in which the particles are not soluble. In addition, the product is sonicated while a gas is bubbled through the suspension, and this results in the formation of microspheres by the solid particles.

Concepts.definition: A suspension intended for injection and is sonicated while a gas is bubbled through the suspension resulting in the creation of microspheres by the solid particles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid parenteral pharmaceutical dosage form structured as a multilamellar composition of concentric phospholipid spheres that encapsulate the drug (drug delivery systems) separated by layers of water. Drug release is facilitated and controlled by in vivo erosion of the liposomes. To further increase the in vivo circulation time, liposomes in some preparations are covalently derivatized with PEG to produce PEGylated or stealth liposomes. Covalent attachment of drugs to the outer surface of liposomes can potentially serve as a delayed-release product.

Concepts.definition: A suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) encapsulated in liposomes and intended for injection.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile preparation intended for parenteral use which has been formulated in a manner to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form (e.g., as a solution or a prompt drug-releasing, conventional solid dosage form).

Concepts.longName: Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A suspension intended for injection that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation, suitable for injection, which consists of solid particles dispersed throughout a liquid phase in which the particles are not soluble. It can also consist of an oil phase dispersed throughout an aqueous phase, or vice-versa.

Concepts.definition: A suspension intended for injection.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Concentrate for Injectable Solution Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Concentrate for Injectable Solution Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile preparation for parenteral use which, upon the addition of suitable solvents, yields a solution conforming in all respects to the requirements for Injections.

Concepts.definition: A concentrate which is usually diluted prior to administration by injection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation containing one or more drug substances dissolved in a suitable solvent or mixture of mutually miscible solvents that is suitable for injection.

Concepts.definition: A solution intended for injection.

PermissibleValues.value: INJECTION, POWDER, LYOPHILIZED, FOR SUSPENSION, EXTENDED RELEASE
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lyophilized Powder For Extended Release Injectable Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lyophilized Powder For Extended Release Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile freeze dried preparation intended for reconstitution for parenteral use which has been formulated in a manner to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form (e.g., as a solution).

Concepts.longName: Lyophilized Powder for Extended Release Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A freeze dried powder intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution for the preparation of an iced saline slush, which is administered by irrigation and used to induce regional hypothermia (in conditions such as certain open heart and kidney surgical procedures) by its direct application.

Concepts.definition: A solution composed of an iced saline slurry with or without active and/or inert ingredient(s) intended to induce regional hypothermia from the point of administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation (i.e., a substance that flows readily in its natural state) that contains a drug dissolved in a suitable solvent or mixture of mutually miscible solvents; the drug has been strengthened by the evaporation of its non-active parts.

Concepts.definition: A concentrate which is usually diluted prior to administration and exists as a solution in its final form.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clear, homogeneous liquid dosage form that contains one or more chemical substances dissolved in a solvent or mixture of mutually miscible solvents. Note: A liquid is pourable; it flows and conforms to its container at room temperature. It displays Newtonian or pseudoplastic flow behavior.

Concepts.definition: A clear, homogeneous liquid composed of one or more chemical substances dissolved in a solvent or mixture of mutually miscible solvents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any compound of one or more fatty acids, or their equivalents, with an alkali; soap is detergent and is much employed in liniments, enemas, and in making pills. It is also a mild aperient, antacid and antiseptic.

Concepts.definition: An anionic surfactant for cleansing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid soap or detergent containing one or more solid, insoluble substances dispersed in a liquid vehicle that is used to clean the hair and scalp and is often used as a vehicle for dermatologic agents.

Concepts.definition: A suspension composed of anionic surfactant and intended for administration to the hair and/or scalp.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid soap or detergent used to clean the hair and scalp and is often used as a vehicle for dermatologic agents.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension composed of an anionic surfactant and intended for administration to the hair and/or scalp.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A thick ointment or cerate (a fat or wax based preparation with a consistency between an ointment and a plaster).

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a thick, fat or wax-based ointment or cerate with a consistency somewhere between an ointment and a plaster.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid used to cleanse by flushing.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension intended for irrigation purposes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small circular object with a vacant circular center that is usually intended to be placed in the body by special inserters, where the medication is released, generally for localized effects.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed active and/or inert ingredient(s) of in the shape of a hoop.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lyophilized Powder For Injectable Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lyophilized Powder For Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation, intended for parenteral use, that contains solids suspended in a suitable fluid medium and conforms in all respects to the requirements for Sterile Suspensions; the medicinal agents intended for the suspension are prepared by lyophilization ("freeze drying"), a process which involves the removal of water from products in the frozen state at extremely low pressures.

Concepts.longName: Lyophilized Powder for Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A freeze dried powder intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a suspension.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lyophilized Powder For Injectable Solution Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lyophilized Powder For Injectable Solution Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosage form intended for the solution prepared by lyophilization ('freeze drying'), a process which involves the removal of water from products in the frozen state at extremely low pressures; this is intended for subsequent addition of liquid to create a solution that conforms in all respects to the requirements for Injections.

Concepts.longName: Lyophilized Powder for Injectable Solution Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A freeze dried powder intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a solution.

PermissibleValues.value: INJECTION, POWDER, LYOPHILIZED, FOR LIPOSOMAL SUSPENSION
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lyophilized Powder For Injectable Liposomal Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lyophilized Powder For Injectable Liposomal Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile freeze dried preparation intended for reconstitution for parenteral use which has been formulated in a manner that would allow liposomes (a lipid bilayer vesicle usually composed of phospholipids which is used to encapsulate an active drug substance, either within a lipid bilayer or in an aqueous space) to be formed upon reconstitution.

Concepts.longName: Lyophilized Powder for Injectable Liposomal Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A freeze dried powder composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) encapsulated in liposomes and intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a suspension.

PermissibleValues.value: INJECTION, POWDER, FOR SUSPENSION, EXTENDED RELEASE
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Powder For Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Powder For Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile freeze dried preparation intended for reconstitution to form a suspension for parenteral use which has been formulated in a manner to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form (e.g., as a solution).

Concepts.longName: Powder for Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A powder intended for injection following reconstitution to form a suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Powder For Injectable Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Powder For Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile preparation intended for reconstitution to form a suspension for parenteral use.

Concepts.longName: Powder for Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A powder intended for injection following reconstitution to form a suspension.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Powder For Injectable Solution Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Powder For Injectable Solution Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sterile preparation intended for reconstitution to form a solution for parenteral use.

Concepts.longName: Powder for Injectable Solution Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A powder intended for injection following reconstitution to form a solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: [definition pending]

Concepts.definition: A substance composed of complexed active and/or inert ingredient(s) with natural or synthetic lipids that is intended for injection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An emulsion, a two-phase system in which one liquid is dispersed throughout another liquid in the form of small droplets, consisting of a sterile, pyrogen-free preparation intended to be administered parenterally.

Concepts.definition: An emulsion intended for injection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An injection, which either consists of or forms liposomes (a lipid bilayer vesicle usually composed of phospholipids which is used to encapsulate an active drug substance).

Concepts.definition: A substance composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) encapsulated in liposomes and intended for injection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A special class of inhalations consisting of a drug or combination of drugs, that by virtue of their high vapor pressure, can be carried by an air current into the nasal passage where they exert their effect; the container from which the inhalant generally is administered is known as an inhaler.

Concepts.definition: Vaporized active and/or inert ingredient(s) intended for administration by inhalation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A material containing drug intended to be inserted securely of deeply in a living site for growth, slow release, or formation of an organic union.

Concepts.definition: A solid intended for insertion securely within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intimate mixture of dry, finely divided drugs and/or chemicals, which, upon the addition of suitable vehicles, yields a solution.

Concepts.definition: A powder that yields a solution following reconstitution with an appropriate liquid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A powder dosage form that is situated inside a container that has a mechanism to deliver a specified quantity.

Concepts.definition: A powder contained in a device with valves that permits the dispensing of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intimate mixture of dry, finely divided drugs and/or chemicals, which, upon the addition of suitable vehicles, yields a suspension (a liquid preparation containing the solid particles dispersed in the liquid vehicle).

Concepts.definition: A powder that forms a suspension when reconstituted with a liquid solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A powder formulation intended to clean and/or polish the teeth, and which may contain certain additional agents.

Concepts.definition: A powder composed of a mild abrasives, detergents, flavoring agents, binders, fluoride, and other active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A soft, moist mass of meal, herbs, seed, etc., usually applied hot in cloth that consists of gruel-like consistency.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a soft, moist mass that is made by wetting an absorbent solid substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Substance intended for external application made of such materials and of such consistency as to adhere to the skin and attach to a dressing; plasters are intended to afford protection and support and/or to furnish an occlusion and macerating action and to bring medication into close contact with the skin.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a soft, smooth mass with relatively thick consistency and strong adhesiveness that becomes solid when dry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose of medicine in the form of a small pellet.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a small, round object composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Coated Pellets Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Coated Pellets Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug itself is in the form of granules to which varying amounts of coating have been applied, and which releases a drug (or drugs) in such a manner to allow a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug (or drugs) presented as a conventional dosage form

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Coated Pellet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A pellet covered with a thin layer of substance that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small sterile solid mass consisting of a highly purified drug (with or without excipients) made by the formation of granules, or by compression and molding; they are intended for implantation in the body (usually subcutaneously) for the purpose of providing continuous release of the drug over long periods of time.

Concepts.definition: A pellet intended for insertion securely within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small sterile solid mass consisting of a highly purified drug (with or without excipients) made by the formation of granules, or by compression and molding.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a small granular or compressed mass that contains highly purified active and/or inert ingredient(s).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Electrically Controlled Extended Release Patch Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Electrically Controlled Extended Release Patch Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug delivery system in the form of a patch which is controlled by an electric current that releases the drug in such a manner that a reduction in dosing frequency compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form (e.g., a solution or a prompt drug-releasing, conventional solid dosage form).

Concepts.longName: Electrically Controlled Extended Release Patch Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A patch that composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) whose release is controlled by electronic impulses that release ingredients at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug delivery system in the form of a patch that releases the drug in such a manner that a reduction in dosing frequency compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form (e.g., a solution or a prompt drug-releasing, conventional solid dosage form).

Concepts.definition: A patch designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An aromatic preparation, often with a pleasing flavor, usually intended to dissolve in the mouth.

Concepts.definition: A solid or semi-solid composed of a lozenge, that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s) that dissolves when sucked in the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A paste formulation intended to clean and/or polish the teeth, and which may contain certain additional agents.

Concepts.definition: A paste of mild abrasives, detergents, flavoring agents, binders, fluoride, and other active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A semisolid dosage form, containing a large proportion (20 - 50%) of solids finely dispersed in a fatty vehicle. This dosage form is generally for external application to the skin or mucous membranes. Note: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a large proportion of solids and finely dispersed active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a fat-based vehicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A material, usually covered by or impregnated with a drug, that is inserted into a body cavity or between the tooth enamel and the gingival margin.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a material that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s) which is intended to be placed in a cavity or depression within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An ointment dosage form that enhances drug delivery. Augmentation does not refer to the strength of the drug in the dosage form. NOTE: CDER has decided to refrain from expanding the use of this dosage form due to difficulties in setting specific criteria that must be met to be considered augmented.

Concepts.definition: An ointment that is modified to enhance the release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unctuous, combustible substance which is liquid, or easily liquefiable, on warming, and is soluble in ether but insoluble in water. Such substances, depending on their origin, are classified as animal, mineral, or vegetable oils.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension that is hydrophobic, soluble in organic solvents, and liquid at ambient temperature.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution or suspension intended for oral administration, for its deodorizing or antiseptic effects in the oral cavity. Usually, the mouthwash is swished around the mouth and expelled.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension intended for oral administration, for its deodorizing or antiseptic effects in the oral cavity. Usually, the mouthwash is swished around the mouth and expelled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid preparation containing one or more medicaments, usually in a flavored, sweetened base which is intended to dissolve or disintegrate slowly in the mouth. A lollipop is a lozenge on a stick.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), sweeteners, other flavorings and mucilage, intended for oral administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lotion dosage form which has a soap or detergent that is usually used to clean the hair and scalp; it is often used as a vehicle for dermatologic agents.

Concepts.definition: A lotion composed of anionic surfactant intended for administration to the hair or scalp.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lotion dosage form that enhances drug delivery. Augmentation does not refer to the strength of the drug in the dosage form. NOTE: CDER has decided to refrain from expanding the use of this dosage form due to difficulties in setting specific criteria that must be met to be considered augmented.

Concepts.definition: A lotion that is modified to enhance the release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation for bathing the skin, or an injured or diseased part, either for a medicinal purpose, or for improving its appearance. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of an oil in water emulsion, with lower viscosity than cream or gel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A state of a substance that is an intermediate one, and which is entered into as matter goes from solid to gas; liquids are also intermediate in that they have neither the orderliness of a crystal nor the randomness of a gas. (Note: This term should not be used to describe solutions, but rather only pure chemicals in their liquid state); it delivers a drug in such a manner to allow a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug (or drugs) presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A state of substance that is an intermediate one entered into as matter goes from solid to gas; liquids are also intermediate in that they have neither the orderliness of a crystal nor the randomness of a gas. (Note: This term should not be used to describe solutions, only pure chemicals in their liquid state.)

Concepts.definition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A waxy solid, usually colored cosmetic, in stick form for the lips.

Concepts.definition: A solid or semi-solid with a waxy consistency in the shape of a stick and intended for use on the lips.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution or mixture of various substances in oil, alcoholic solutions of soap, or emulsions intended for external application.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid with viscosity similar to that of a lotion, which is intended for topical use and must be rubbed into the site of administration to release the active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A material applied to the inside of the dental cavity, for protection or insulation of the surface.

Concepts.definition: A resinous film-forming agent dissolved in a solvent or a calcium hydroxide suspension within a synthetic resin solution, which rapidly hardens into a firm mass upon administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A packaged collection of related material.

Concepts.definition: A collection of unrelated materials that are used together to orchestrate dosage administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of gels--semisolid systems which consist of suspensions made up of either small inorganic particles or large organic molecules interpenetrated by a liquid--in which the structural coherent matrix contains a high portion of liquid, usually water.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of suspensions of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in any type of highly viscous material, including gelatin or gel. The structural matrix of the jelly contains high levels of liquid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A product that is packaged under pressure and contains therapeutically active ingredients that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system; it is intended for topical application to the skin as well as local application into the nose (nasal aerosols), mouth (lingual aerosols), or lungs (inhalation aerosols).

Concepts.definition: Contents packaged under pressure that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid contained within either a hard or soft soluble shell, usually prepared from gelatin.

Concepts.definition: A solid contained within either a hard or soft soluble shell, usually prepared from gelatin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A semisolid emulsion of either the oil-in-water or the water-in-oil type, ordinarily intended for topical use. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of an emulsion of lipids, hydrocarbons, waxes, or polyols in water.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any elastic aeriform fluid in which the molecules are separated from one another and have free paths.

Concepts.definition: An elastic aeriform fluid in which the molecules are separated from one another and have freedom of movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A semisolid (1) dosage form that contains a gelling agent to provide stiffness to a solution or a colloidal dispersion (2). A gel may contain suspended particles. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: A colloidal dispersion is a system in which particles of colloidal dimension (i.e., typically between 1 nm and 1 micrometer) are distributed uniformly throughout a liquid.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a solid, three dimensional, cross linked matrix of polymers within a liquid, yielding a jelly-like material unable to flow at steady state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A suspension or emulsion, semisolid (1) dosage form, usually containing < 20% water and volatiles (2) and > 50% hydrocarbons, waxes, or polyols as the vehicle. This dosage form is generally for external application to the skin or mucous membranes. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: Percent water and volatiles are measured by a loss on drying test in which the sample is heated at 105 degrees C until constant weight is achieved.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid, viscous in texture, that may be composed of a variety of bases including hydrocarbons, emulsifiers or vegetable oils, and mixed with active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug delivery system that often contains an adhesive backing that is usually applied to an external site on the body. Its ingredients either passively diffuse from, or are actively transported from, some portion of the patch. Depending upon the patch, the ingredients are either delivered to the outer surface of the body or into the body. A patch is sometimes synonymous with the terms Extended Release Film and System.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of an impermeable occlusive backing and a formulation matrix in which the active and/or inert ingredient(s) are dissolved or dispersed; possibly includes an adhesive layer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intimate mixture of dry, finely divided drugs and/or chemicals that may be intended for internal or external use.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a mixture of dry, finely divided active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid minutely divided as by a jet of air or steam.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in oil or water, typically dispensed from an atomizer or nebulizer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid body of various weights and shapes, adapted for introduction into the rectal, vaginal, or urethral orifice of the human body; they usually melt, soften, or dissolve at body temperature.

Concepts.definition: A solid or semi-solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a wax, fat or a glycerin gelatin jelly and that is conical or oval in shape. It is intended to be inserted into a body orifice.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation which consists of solid particles dispersed throughout a liquid phase in which the particles are not soluble.

Concepts.definition: Insoluble solid particles composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that are dispersed in a liquid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a mixture of that active and/or inert ingredient(s) are pressed or compacted together, usually in the form of a relatively flat and round, square or oval shape.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A thin slice of material containing a medicinal agent.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a thin slice of material that contain active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosage form has yet to be assigned.

Concepts.definition: An indication that the dosage form has yet to be assigned.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Coated Capsule Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Coated Capsule Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container or "shell" made from a suitable form of gelatin; additionally, the capsule is covered in a designated coating, and which releases a drug (or drugs) in such a manner to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug (or drugs) presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Coated Capsule Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A capsule covered with a thin layer of substance and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Coated Pellets in Capsule Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Coated Pellets in Capsule Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container or "shell" made from a suitable form of gelatin; the drug itself is in the form of granules to which varying amounts of coating have been applied.

Concepts.longName: Coated Pellet in Capsule Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A capsule composed of small globular masses covered with an outer shell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An aerosol product which utilizes a compressed gas as the propellant to provide the force necessary to expel the product as a wet spray; it is applicable to solutions of medicinal agents in aqueous solvents.

Concepts.definition: A spray that is packaged under pressure and released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A product that is packaged under pressure and contains therapeutically active ingredients, in the form of a powder, that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.

Concepts.definition: A powder composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) and packaged under pressure. Ingredients are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pressurized dosage form consisting of metered dose valves which allow for the delivery of a uniform quantity of spray upon each activation.

Concepts.definition: An aerosol contained in a device with valves that permits the release of a specified quantity of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An emulsion containing one or more active ingredients, surfactants, aqueous or non-aqueous liquids, and the propellants; if the propellant is in the internal (discontinuous) phase (i.e., of the oil-in-water type), a stable foam is discharged, and if the propellant is in the external (continuous) phase (i.e., of the water-in-oil type), a spray or a quick-breaking foam is discharged.

Concepts.definition: A foam that is packaged under pressure and released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Natural mixture of gum and resin, usually obtained as exudations from plants.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a mixture of gum and a plant based hydrocarbon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sweetened and flavored insoluble plastic material of various shapes which when chewed, releases a drug substance into the oral cavity.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of synthetic, polymerized polysaccharide and flavorings, intended to be chewed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mucilaginous excretion from various plants.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a sticky, mucilaginous polysaccharide.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Granule For Suspension Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Granule For Suspension Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small medicinal particle or grain made available in its more stable dry form, to be reconstituted with solvent just before dispensing to form a suspension; the extended release system achieves slow release of the drug over an extended period of time and maintains constant drug levels in the blood or target tissue.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Granule for Suspension Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A granule intended for administration as a suspension and designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small medicinal particle or grain made available in its more stable dry form, to be reconstituted with solvent just before dispensing to form a suspension; the granules are so prepared to contain not only the medicinal agent, but the colorants, flavorants, and any other desired pharmaceutic ingredient.

Concepts.definition: A granule intended for administration as a suspension.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small medicinal particle or grain made available in its more stable dry form, to be reconstituted with solvent just before dispensing; the granules are so prepared to contain not only the medicinal agent, but the colorants, flavorants, and any other desired pharmaceutic ingredient. (Dorland's Illustrated Medical Dictionary, 24th Ed.; INTRODUCTION TO PHARMACEUTICAL DOSAGE FORMS, 4th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: A granule intended for administration as a solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small particle or grain containing a medicinal agent in a dry mixture usually composed of sodium bicarbonate, citric acid, and tartaric acid which, when in contact with water, has the capability to release gas, resulting in effervescence.

Concepts.definition: A granule composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), and a mixture of acids and sodium bicarbonate, which release carbon dioxide when dissolved in water.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small medicinal particle or grain to which an enteric or other coating has been applied, thus delaying release of the drug until its passage into the intestines.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of small particles or grains and have been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small particle or grain.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of small particles or grains.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A slip of skin or of other tissue for implantation.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a piece of skin or other tissue intended for implantation into or on the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Also called pellets or pilules, are made of pure sucrose, lactose, or other polysaccharides. They are formed into small globular masses of various sizes, and are medicated by placing them in a vial and adding the liquid drug attenuation in the proportion not less than one percent (v/w). After shaking, the medicated globules are dried at temperatures not to exceed 40 degrees Centigrade.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of sucrose, lactose or other polysaccharides formed into small globular pellets impregnated with active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An apparatus for the formation of vapor or gas from a liquid or solid by heat or chemical action. The term GENERATOR also applies to radioactive columns from which radionuclides are provided.

Concepts.definition: An apparatus that converts solutions, suspensions or solids, composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) into a vapor or gas by heat or chemical reaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gel preparation, with metered dose valves, which allow for the delivery of a uniform quantity of gel upon each activation.

Concepts.definition: A gel contained in a device with valves that permits the release of a uniform dose of gel that composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A combination of a dentifrice (formulation intended to clean and/or polish the teeth, and which may contain certain additional agents), and a gel (a semisolid system which consists of suspensions made up of either small inorganic particles or large organic molecules interpenetrated by a liquid) and which is used with a toothbrush for the purpose of cleaning and polishing the teeth.

Concepts.definition: A gel intended for use in the oral cavity to clean the teeth and maintain oral hygiene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A formed or molded oral gel dosage form that maintains its shape, is elastic, and yields to mastication.

Concepts.definition: A formed or molded oral gel dosage form that maintains its shape, is elastic, and yields to mastication.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Dosage Form For Suspension

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Dosage Form For Suspension
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A product, usually a solid, intended for suspension prior to administration; once the suspension is administered, the drug will be released at a constant rate over a specified period.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Dosage Form for Suspension
Concepts.definition: A substance that forms a suspension upon reconstitution and designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A product, usually a solid, intended for suspension prior to administration.

Concepts.definition: A substance intended for administration as a suspension.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A product, usually a solid, intended for solution prior to administration.

Concepts.definition: A substance intended for administration as a solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A thin layer or coating which is susceptible to being dissolved when in contact with a liquid.

Concepts.definition: A film that will dissolve in a liquid solvent to form a solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug delivery system in the form of a film that releases the drug over an extended period in such a way as to maintain constant drug levels in the blood or target tissue.

Concepts.definition: A film that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A thin layer or coating.

Concepts.definition: A thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer intended to coat the site of administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A slender and elongated solid thread-like substance that delivers drug in such a manner to allow a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug (or drugs) presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.definition: A solid in the shape of a slender, elongated thread that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container or "shell" made from a suitable form of gelatin; additionally, the capsule is covered in a designated coating.

Concepts.definition: A capsule that contains an additional outer layer over the capsule shell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which a tablet has been compacted into capsule shape.

Concepts.definition: A solid dosage form in which a tablet has been compacted into capsule shape.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Solid dosage form, usually in the shape of a square or rectangle.

Concepts.definition: A solid or semi-solid in the shape of a square or rectangle.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Bead Implant Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Bead Implant Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small sterile solid mass consisting of a highly purified drug intended for implantation in the body which would allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Bead Implant Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A solid in the shape of a small sphere intended to be embedded securely in the body and designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in the shape of a small ball.

Concepts.definition: A solid in the shape of a small sphere.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form usually in the form of a rectangle that is meant to be chewed.

Concepts.definition: A bar designed to be chewed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A concentrated preparation of vegetable or animal drugs obtained by removal of the active constituents of the respective drugs with a suitable menstrua, evaporation of all or nearly all of the solvent, and adjustment of the residual masses or powders to the prescribed standards.

Concepts.definition: A distillate composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) extracted from plant or animal matter, and represented in concentrated form.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rectal preparation for therapeutic, diagnostic, or nutritive purposes.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension intended for administration into the rectum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosage form consisting of a two-phase system comprised of at least two immiscible liquids (1), one of which is dispersed as droplets (internal or dispersed phase) within the other liquid (external or continuous phase), generally stabilized with one or more emulsifying agents. Note 1: A liquid is pourable; it flows and conforms to its container at room temperature. It displays Newtonian or pseudoplastic flow behavior. Note 2: Emulsion is used as a dosage form term unless a more specific term is applicable, e.g. cream, lotion, ointment.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of at least two immiscible liquids, one of which is dispersed as droplets within the other liquid, and stabilized with one or more emulsifying agents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clear, pleasantly flavored, sweetened hydroalcoholic liquid containing dissolved medicinal agents; it is intended for oral use.

Concepts.definition: A solution composed of a clear, sweetened hydroalcoholic liquid in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) are dissolved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Modern technology, distributed with or as a part of a drug product that allows for the uniform release or targeting of drugs to the body.

Concepts.definition: Modern technology, distributed with or as a part of a drug product that allows for the uniform release or targeting of drugs to the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container made from a suitable form of gelatin, and which releases a drug (or drugs) in such a manner to allow a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug (or drugs) presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.definition: A capsule designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The application of various materials for protecting a wound.

Concepts.definition: A substance intended for administration in or on a wound.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation, intended for the irrigative cleansing of the vagina, that is prepared from powders, liquid solutions, or liquid concentrates and contains one or more chemical substances dissolved in a suitable solvent or mutually miscible solvents.

Concepts.definition: A substance intended for use as a vaginal irrigant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A circular plate-like organ or structure.

Concepts.definition: A flat, circular shaped form composed of a solid or powder that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A device usually dome-shaped, worn during copulation over the cervical mouth for prevention of conception or infection.

Concepts.definition: A dome-shaped insert with a springy, flexible rim intended to be inserted into the vagina and positioned behind the pelvic bone to completely cover the cervix.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The propagation of microorganisms or of living tissue cells in special media conducive to their growth.

Concepts.definition: A solution, suspension or semi-solid composed of media conducive to microbial growth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A naturally produced angular solid of definite form in which the ultimate units from which it is built up are systematically arranged; they are usually evenly spaced on a regular space lattice.

Concepts.definition: A solid that consists of naturally produced angular solids composed of singular, repeating units that are systematically arranged in an evenly spaced lattice.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cream dosage form that enhances drug delivery. Augmentation does not refer to the strength of the drug in the dosage form. NOTE: CDER has decided to refrain from expanding the use of this dosage form due to difficulties in setting specific criteria that must be met to be considered augmented.

Concepts.definition: A cream that is modified to enhance the release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An ocular system placed in the eye from which the drug diffuses through a membrane at a constant rate over a specified period.

Concepts.definition: A solid or liquid core composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) enclosed by a polymer coated shell. It is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form bounded by a circular base and the surface formed by line segments joining every point of the boundary of the base to a common vertex. A cone (usually containing antibiotics) is normally placed below the gingiva after a dental extraction.

Concepts.definition: A solid with a shape bounded by a circular base converging upon a single vertex.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid preparation of increased strength and reduced volume which is usually diluted prior to administration.

Concepts.definition: A solution or suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) with increased strength in a reduced volume, which is usually diluted prior to administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large piece of relatively flat, absorbent material that contains a drug. It is typically used for applying medication or for cleansing.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a woven absorbent material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A narrow tube of cut tobacco (or other similar material) enclosed in paper and designed for smoking.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) wrapped in a paper cylinder whereby one end is burned. The ingredient is released in a smoke form, which is inhaled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance that serves to produce solid union between two surfaces.

Concepts.definition: A base composed of bonding agents intermingled with active and/or inert ingredient(s), which rapidly hardens into a firm mass upon application.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within a soluble, gelatin shell which is plasticized by the addition of a polyol, such as sorbitol or glycerin, and is therefore of a somewhat thicker consistency than that of a hard shell capsule; typically, the active ingredients are dissolved or suspended in a liquid vehicle.

Concepts.definition: A capsule composed of liquid covered with an outer shell, which is usually prepared from gelatin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A capsule dosage form that is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon administration with no enhanced, delayed or extended release effect.

Concepts.definition: A capsule dosage form that is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon administration with no enhanced, delayed or extended release effect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container made from a suitable form of gelatin; through a banding process, the capsule is coated with additional layers of gelatin so as to form a complete seal.

Concepts.definition: A capsule covered with a thin layer of gelatin.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Film Coated Capsule Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Film Coated Capsule Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container or "shell" made from a suitable form of gelatin; additionally, the capsule is covered in a designated film coating, and which releases a drug (or drugs) in such a manner to allow at least a reduction in dosing frequency as compared to that drug (or drugs) presented as a conventional dosage form.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Film Coated Capsule Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A capsule covered with a thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Delayed Release Pellets in Capsule Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Delayed Release Pellets in Capsule Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container or "shell" made from a suitable form of gelatin; the drug itself is in the form of granules to which enteric coating has been applied, thus delaying release of the drug until its passage into the intestines.

Concepts.longName: Delayed Release Pellet in Capsule Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A capsule composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) small, spherical structures that have been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form in which the drug is enclosed within either a hard or soft soluble container made from a suitable form of gelatin, and which releases a drug (or drugs) at a time other than promptly after administration. Enteric-coated articles are delayed release dosage forms.

Concepts.definition: A capsule covered with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Capsule, Softgel Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Capsule, Softgel Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A capsule, covered with a soft gelatin shell and containing a liquid, suspension, or semisolid, that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate to reduce dosing frequency.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Capsule, Softgel Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A capsule, covered with a soft gelatin shell and containing a liquid, suspension, or semisolid, that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate to reduce dosing frequency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extended Release Capsule, Hard Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extended Release Capsule, Hard Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A capsule, covered with a rigid outer shell, that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate to reduce dosing frequency.

Concepts.longName: Extended Release Capsule, Hard Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A capsule, covered with a rigid outer shell, that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate to reduce dosing frequency.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Solid Dispersion Immediate Release Tablet Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Solid Dispersion Immediate Release Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing one or more active pharmaceutical ingredient which can be dispersed in a carrier at solid state, and immediately released upon administration.

Concepts.longName: Solid Dispersion Immediate Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A solid dosage form containing one or more active pharmaceutical ingredient which can be dispersed in a carrier at solid state, and immediately released upon administration.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Short Modified Release Tablet Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Short Modified Release Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tablet exhibiting an altered inherent rate of release of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that is classified as short.

Concepts.longName: Short Modified Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A tablet exhibiting an altered inherent rate of release of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that is classified as short.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Long Modified Release Tablet Dosage Form

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Long Modified Release Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tablet exhibiting an altered inherent rate of release of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that is classified as long.

Concepts.longName: Long Modified Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A tablet exhibiting an altered inherent rate of release of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that is classified as long.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tablet exhibiting an altered inherent rate of release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

Concepts.definition: A tablet exhibiting an altered inherent rate of release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance having definite shape and volume manufactured for the administration of active and/or inert ingredient(s). Solids include tablets, capsules, powders, granules and certain suppositories.

Concepts.definition: A substance having definite shape and volume manufactured for the administration of active and/or inert ingredient(s). Solids include tablets, capsules, powders, granules and certain suppositories.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A ring composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), intended for administration in or around the vagina.

Concepts.definition: A ring composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), intended for administration in or around the vagina.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Solid preparation consisting of a capsule formulation intended for generation of vapor to be inhaled to obtain a local effect. The vapor is usually generated by adding the whole capsule or the capsule contents to hot water.

Concepts.definition: Solid preparation consisting of a capsule formulation intended for generation of vapor to be inhaled to obtain a local effect. The vapor is usually generated by adding the whole capsule or the capsule contents to hot water.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A capsule, covered with a soft gelatin shell and containing a liquid, suspension, or semisolid, that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s)

Concepts.definition: A capsule, covered with a soft gelatin shell and containing a liquid, suspension, or semisolid, that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Parenteral sustained-release systems of microparticles, implants, or biodegradable polymer-excipients designed to release their active pharmaceutical ingredient over a prolonged period of time.

Concepts.definition: Parenteral sustained-release systems of microparticles, implants, or biodegradable polymer-excipients designed to release their active pharmaceutical ingredient over a prolonged period of time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A granule whose outer shell is covered with a substance.

Concepts.definition: A granule whose outer shell is covered with a substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of lyophilized powder.

Concepts.definition: A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of lyophilized powder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the dosage form is not relevant or appropriate.

Concepts.definition: An indication that the dosage form is not relevant or appropriate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The type of pharmaceutical dose form is unknown, or has unspecified or variable physical characteristics.

Concepts.definition: The type of pharmaceutical dose form is unknown, or has unspecified or variable physical characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents that is crushed prior to administration.

Concepts.definition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents that is crushed prior to administration.

PermissibleValues.value: TABLET, FILM COATED, IMMEDIATE RELEASE, CRUSHED

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Film Coated Immediate Release Crushed Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a thin layer of a water-insoluble or water-soluble polymer that is crushed prior to administration. The tablet is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) immediately upon administration.

Concepts.longName: Film Coated Immediate Release Crushed Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a thin layer of a water-insoluble or water-soluble polymer that is crushed prior to administration. The tablet is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) immediately upon administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Film Coated Immediate Release Tablet Dosage Form
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a thin layer of a water-insoluble or water-soluble polymer; the tablet is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) immediately upon administration.

Concepts.longName: Film Coated Immediate Release Tablet Dosage Form
Concepts.definition: A solid dosage form that contains medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents and is coated with a thin layer of a water-insoluble or water-soluble polymer; the tablet is designed to release its active and/or inert ingredient(s) immediately upon administration.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Pharmaceutical Dosage Form Terminology Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The form of the completed pharmaceutical product, e.g. tablet, capsule, injection, elixir, suppository. Dosage form can have a significant effect on the onset, duration and intensity of the pharmacological action of a drug. A pharmaceutical dosage form controls the rate at which the drug is released into the biological fluids. This release rate affects its intrinsic absorption pattern and therefore, the bioavailability of the drug.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: CDISC SDTM Pharmaceutical Dosage Form Terminology
Concepts.definition: Terminology codelist used with Pharmaceutical Dosage Form within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
